articles.author: MICHAEL LIEDTKE, LINDSAY WHITEHURST, FRANK BAJAK and MIKE BALSAMO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Justice Department on Thursday announced a sweeping antitrust lawsuit against Apple, accusing the tech giant of engineering an illegal monopoly in smartphones that boxes out competitors, stifles innovation and keeps prices artificially high.
articles.title: Justice Department sues Apple, alleging it illegally monopolized the smartphone market

articles.author: GENE JOHNSON and MARK THIESSEN
articles.description: Police on Thursday arrested two white supremacist gang members — an Idaho prison inmate and the accomplice who helped him escape — following an attack on corrections officers at a Boise hospital, and investigators are looking into whether they killed two people while on the run.
articles.title: Police track down escaped Idaho prison gang member and accomplice, say pair may have killed 2 on run

articles.author: ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: BOSTON (AP) — A federal appeals court on Thursday ordered Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev's case to be returned to a lower court to probe claims of juror bias and determine whether his death sentence should stand.
articles.title: Appeals court orders judge to probe claims of juror bias in Boston Marathon bomber's case

articles.description: TULSA, Okla. (AP) — An Oklahoma district attorney said Thursday he doesn’t plan to file any charges in the case of Nex Benedict, the 16-year-old Owasso teenager whose death following a fight in a high school bathroom was ruled a suicide.
articles.title: No charges to be filed in fight involving Oklahoma nonbinary teen Nex Benedict

articles.author: MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Thursday a major Israeli ground assault on the southern Gaza town of Rafah would be “a mistake” and “unnecessary” to defeating Hamas, underscoring the further souring of relations between the United States and Israel.
articles.title: Blinken says Israeli assault on Gaza's Rafah would be a 'mistake' and isn't needed to defeat Hamas

articles.author: KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Lawmakers introduced a $1.2 trillion spending package Thursday that sets the stage for avoiding a partial government shutdown for several key federal agencies this weekend and allows Congress, nearly six months into the budget year, to complete its work funding the government through September.
articles.title: Congress unveils $1.2 trillion plan to avert federal shutdown and bring budget fight to a close

articles.author: MICHAEL GOLDBERG and EMILY WAGSTER PETTUS
articles.description: JACKSON, Miss. (AP) — A federal judge on Thursday finished handing down prison terms of about 10 to 40 years to six white former Mississippi law enforcement officers who pleaded guilty to breaking into a home without a warrant and torturing two Black men in an hourslong attack that included beatings, repeated uses of stun guns and assaults with a sex toy before one of the victims was shot in the mouth.
articles.title: White former officers get sentences of 10 to 40 years in torture of 2 Black men in Mississippi

articles.author: JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Former President Donald Trump's lawyers kept pressing an appellate court Thursday to excuse him from covering a $454 million fraud lawsuit judgment for now, saying he'd suffer “irreparable harm" before his appeal is decided.
articles.title: Trump's lawyers keep fighting $454M fraud appeal bond requirement

articles.author: MICHAEL LIEDTKE and WYATTE GRANTHAM-PHILIPS
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Reddit's stock soared in its Wall Street debut as investors pushed the value of the company close to $9 billion seconds after it began trading on the New York Stock Exchange.Reddit, which priced its IPO at $34 a share, debuted Thursday afternoon at $47 a share.
articles.title: Reddit, the self-anointed 'front page of the internet,' soars in Wall Street debut

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description:
The Latest on the first full day of the NCAA Tournament:No. 3 Illinois rallies past Morehead State
Marcus Domask had the 10th triple-double in men’s tournament history, and third-seeded Illinois rallied past 14th-seeded Morehead State 85-69 in the first round of the East Region.
articles.title: NCAA Tournament Latest: No. 3 Illinois rallies past Morehead State
